column1: Team Introduction

The goal of the USTS Data Science team is to ensure TikTok can effectively and efficiently make data-driven decisions while protecting the privacy and integrity of US user data. We aim to achieve three major business objectives:
1. Grow US TikTok users through analytics of user growth levers (e.g. notifications
2. Identify growth opportunities for big-bet TikTok business initiatives (e.g. Live
3. Build data infrastructure to alleviate TikTok business disruption as a result of more restrictive access to US user data.

column3: TX for a large Telecommunication company. This Data Scientist will be joining the Customer Operations team involved in analyzing call center data. Their main goals are to decrease call volume and prevent churn. One of the projects this individual will be working on is an ARC (at-risk Customer) based project which measures the amount customers call into the call center to determine how sensitive they are and if they will churn in the next 30 days. He/she will perform predictive modeling to predict who will call in the next 7 days with more than 50% chance of churn so that they can re-route the call accordingly to a special agent. This Data Scientist will also be working on the Chronical Caller Project in which analyzes the top 5% callers (frequent callers) to come up with a routing solution for them to prevent churn. We also don’t want to set them up with expensive plans if they don’t need them. It’s a balancing act.

column1: Description:

We are looking for an ML/AI Ops Engineer to transform our data science development lifecycle and data creation pipelines to production quality. This person will have a strong computer science background and be excited to embed best coding practices into a growing data science team. They should be equally comfortable with data preparation and analysis as they are with the deployment of enterprise scale models into a production environment. They will build re-usable tools supporting model evaluation and data creation. We are looking for someone who sees the forest through the trees and is comfortable creating a solution to a business problem without needing someone to provide the details of how to implement the solution.

· Skilled at the AWS suite
· Experience with SDLC
· Experience designing
· Bachelor’s degree in STEM or related fields from an accredited university. Graduate degree preferred.
· Strong statistical background
· Comfort working on multiple projects concurrently
· Experience building robust re-usable software tools
Who you are:
Extremely comfortable with scalable
column3: automated data science coding/computer science practices

About Social Standards:

Why are face mask sales exploding? Which craft beer brands are gaining popularity in the Midwest? What are consumers looking for in vodka? Which benefits & concerns are driving specific demographics toward plant-based meats? Is hard seltzer here to stay? A businesses’ ability to understand the answers to these types of questions before it’s too late is the key to whether they succeed or fail.
Here’s the good news: The answers to these questions and many more just like them can be found by examining the world’s largest unfiltered data set
column3: millions of people all over the world post about their interactions with brands and products
column4: giving us a unique and authentic perspective on consumer behaviors and attitudes.

column1: The bad news: Many social tools are not equipped to deliver clear and actionable answers to these questions. To gain an understanding of these posts
column2: most brands currently use traditional social listening methods. Their ability to answer the questions falls short as social listening analysis is limited in its comparative capabilities.

column1: The industry has been in search of a tool that can structure the world’s largest unfiltered data set in an easy-to-use comparative analytics platform. Enter Social Standards.

Social Standards has developed an industry-defining consumer research platform that harnesses the power of collective intelligence to deliver deep insights on consumer conversational data. The platform provides a powerful alternative data set that supplements market and investment analysis by driving a quant-based understanding of consumer motivations and market direction.

The platform is a first-to-market tool which structures the massive set of unfiltered conversational data derived from social channels into market vertical-based ontological relationships. These structured data sets are accessed through an intuitive
column2: multi-screen interface – enabling true comparative analytics and relational mapping
column3: and allowing the user to dive deeply into the consumer conversation.
